data.scheme_name: Micro, Small And Medium Enterprises Promotion Policy - 2022 - Capital Subsidy - Male, Others - General, Other Backward Caste - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provide Capital  Subsidy up to 25%, maximum up to 400 lakh per unit.
data.eligibility: Existing Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises investing for expansion/diversification would be provided with the same facilities under certain terms and conditions.
data.conditions:
1. Incentives under one head/ category, can only be availed under one policy. 
  2. Land cost is not eligible for fiscal incentives under the policy. Land cost can be taken as part of fixed capital investment subject to ceiling of 10% of fixed capital investment. 
  3. Total financial assistance under the policy will be limited to the total fixed capital investment made by the unit.
data.beneficiaries:
1. Micro, small and medium enterprises eligible investment period under the policy will be 2, 3 and 4 years for micro, small and medium enterprises, respectively, from the date of application. 
  2. The units will have to start commercial production during the eligible investment period. 
  3. Total financial assistance under the policy will be limited to the total fixed capital investment made by the unit.
data.prerequisites:
1. Incentives under one head/ category, can only be availed under one policy. 
  2. Land cost is not eligible for fiscal incentives under the policy. 
  3. Land cost can be taken as part of fixed capital investment subject to ceiling of 10% of fixed capital investment. 
  4. Total financial assistance under the policy will be limited to the total fixed capital investment made by the unit.
data.nodal_agency: Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises and Export Promotion department
data.context:
• To position Uttar Pradesh as a top choice for national and global investors, the aim is to promote the growth of Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs). 
  • The goals include achieving 15% annual growth in new businesses, generating maximum employment, and boosting jobs by 15% through the expansion and upgrading of existing units.
data.objective:
• The goal is to support new MSMEs by offering financial assistance based on their investment in plant, machinery, and equipment (excluding land costs). 
  • The assistance varies by enterprise size and region and is paid in two installments as the project progresses, encouraging MSME growth in the state.
data.description:
1. Existing Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) in the State qualify for Investment Promotion Assistance (IPA) based on fixed capital investment, differing by enterprise size and region. 
  2. In Bundelkhand and Purvanchal areas, percentages range from 25% for Micro to 15% for Medium units; in Madhyanchal and Paschimanchal, it's 20% for Micro to 10% for Medium. 
  3. This assistance applies to investments in plant, machinery, and equipment, excluding land costs, and is disbursed in two equal installments. 
  4. ‘Expansion/diversification’ refers to such units, which increase their gross block by at least 25% apart from increasing production capacity by 25 percent, by way of fresh capital investment, for example, purchasing of new machinery/plant for diversification, setting up new production line and purchase of land/building needed for the new production line.
data.how_to_apply:
To get financial assistance under this policy, unit has to apply through on-line mode.(Nivesh Portal)
Eligible units will have to apply to the respective District Industries and Enterprise Promotion Centre.
data.funding_facilitator: Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises and Export Promotion department, Government of Uttarpradesh
data.funding_mechanism:
Capital subsidy will be provided in 2 equal installments. 
First installment is payable once the construction of related buildings is completed. 
Second installment is payable once at least 50% of commercial production has begun.
data.additional_info:
This policy would not be applicable to the following investment proposals; - 

1. Tobacco products, gutkha, pan masala etc;

 2. Alcohol, aerated drinks, carbonated products etc; 

3. Manufacturing of firecrackers; 

4. Plastic carry bags (less than 40 microns) or plastic bags of specified thickness as categorized by the state government from time to time

 5. Other products categorized in the prohibited category from time to time.
data.checklist_info_a:
1.Copy of Udyam Registration Certificate (URC)
2. Certificate of Incorporation/ Partnership deed/Partnership registration/ Co- operative society 
registration. 
3.KYC Details
data.checklist_info_d: Picup Bhawan, Block A, 4th Floor, Lucknow, UP, 0522-3117976, info@investup.org.in
data.beneficiary: Specific Industriy - All Entities - Uttar Pradesh - All MSMEs
